entry.title: Revert "Reland "[customize-chrome][cr2023] Establish dependencies of features in code""
entry.content:
This reverts commit 32f8ef17b71e07b0ebd566fdc6b29e5527bf095d.



Reason for revert: Tests seem to be failing again after reland



Original change's description:

> Reland "[customize-chrome][cr2023] Establish dependencies of features in code"

>

> This reverts commit 5f2a690589d8aaaa71181560acc2d70150773037.

>

> Reason for revert: The revert of another CL fixed test failure. This CL is not related.

>

> Original change's description:

> > Revert "[customize-chrome][cr2023] Establish dependencies of features in code"

> >

> > This reverts commit f0db7b86166ef32ecdfbcb2a72e4a0abe6189db8.

> >

> > Reason for revert: Seems to be causing multiple failures:

> > crbug.com/1467734

> >

> > Original change's description:

> > > [customize-chrome][cr2023] Establish dependencies of features in code

> > >

> > > Chrome Refresh requires the Customize Chrome side panel. This CL ensures

> > > that Chrome Refresh is only enabled if Customize Chrome is enabled, too.

> > >

> > > Additionally, this CL introduces a new feature flag that disables Chrome

> > > Refresh even if Customize Chrome is enabled. This allows us to set up a

> > > holdback experiment for the Customize Chrome side panel where both

> > > experiment arms have Chrome Refresh disabled.

> > >

> > > Things to note:

> > > * Only some Omnibox features need to be gated by Customize Chrome. This

> > > CL adds a helper to gate those specific call sites. The helper lives

> > > in //components/omnibox/common to work around cyclic dependency

> > > issues. This CL modifies DEPS rules accordingly.

> > > * This CL moves ntp_features into a new GN target so that users can

> > > depend on it in isolation. This, too, works around cyclic dependency

> > > issues.

> > >

> > > Bug: 1457991

> > > Change-Id: I13ccb0df1cfa433aa5e10bc2bca5a7933913da6d

entry.title: [WebGL] Remove WEBGL_webcodecs_video_frame extension
entry.content:
This extension was an early prototype what became WebGPU's ability to

import VideoFrames in zero-copy fashion. It proved too difficult to use,

and its spec is currently marked as "Do Not Implement" [1]. This CL

removes its implementation from Chromium and instead makes the extension

unsupported in Chromium. The concrete motivation for doing this now (in

addition to code cleanup) is that its per-texture accesses for each

separate plane of a multiplanar SharedImage are problematic for our

introduction of Multiplanar SharedImage (which has only one texture for

the entire image).



Bug: 1462924

entry.title: Add MoveArgAndReturn to gmock_move_support.
entry.content:
MoveArg currently works only for functions that return void and

constructs of the type

DoAll(MoveArg(...), Return(...))

do not work for arguments passed by value, because all arguments of

DoAll but the last receive only a read-only view of the function's

arguments.

entry.title: [iOS] Trigger the SU interstitital reloading
entry.content:
When a URL filter has been updated for a supervised

user (SU), we check whether we need to refresh a currently

shown blocking interstitial (in case of a block site

approval) or whether we need to trigger an intersitial

creation (in case of new blocking configuration).



A new method, `GetInterstitialType` is added on the

`IOSSecurityInterstitialPage` class, to allow our

use case to distinguish SU interstitials from other

managed security interstitials.



Bug: b/291746667

Change-Id: I4375bc04471eb591447fbacc2646ecc931bb24da

entry.title: [ios] Change Signin completion callback to receive full result and info
entry.content:
Previously the completion callback only received a BOOL to indicate

whether the signin was completed successfully. But in some cases, more

information is needed. In the case of the SetUpList signin item, swipe

to dismiss should be treated differently than the user actively

cancelling the signin by using the secondary button. Since the block now

receives the result, it can differentiate between success, cancels, and

interruptions.



Fixed: 1466484

entry.title: Remove data wipe logic from BrowserDataMigrator.
entry.content:
Data wipe logic was originally introduced in crrev.com/c/2853023 to

ensure that data created before enabling the new AccountManager (in

crrev.com/c/2859408) is not used with Lacros after enabling it. This was

done in M92.



Since crrev.com/c/3233747 in M97, `BrowserDataMigrator` started marking

the completion of profile migration in "Local State" under pref

`lacros.profile_migration_completed_for_user`. Unless the completion is

marked, profile migration will run wiping pre-existing Lacros directory.



Now users with data created by Lacros older than M92 will have to go

through profile migration once the OS is updated to >= M97 even without

data wipe logic. This makes the data wipe logic redundant.



So we remove the data wipe logic.



Test: tast run $DUT lacros.Migrate*

Bug: 1464834

Change-Id: Ic27f430f8c873508e8d746c986e4c40746882bbc

entry.title: [sync] Support GetUploadToGoogleState() in transport mode
entry.content:
Currently, SyncService::GetPreferredDataTypes() has good semantics in

all cases (signed out, transport mode, full-sync mode) and there is no

reason for GetUploadToGoogleState() to require that sync-the-feature is

enabled.



Theoretically, this relaxes the requirements for the predicate, but

in most cases (maybe all) it shouldn't make a difference (until

syncer::kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos is enabled).

entry.title: Distinguish better between updating and filling in PasswordFormManager.
entry.content:
This CL contains no functional changes - it only moves functionality

between methods to have them do fewer things. In particular, it aims to

make it clearer which methods trigger filling.



1) Renames PasswordFormManager::Fill() to FillNow() and makes it

private, since it is not used externally outside of tests.



2) Introduces a new method call Fill() that triggers FillNow() if

predictions are available or DelayedFill() if they are not.



3) Splits up PasswordFormManager::FillForm().

FillForm() currently does a plethora of things:

- It checks whether the FormData passed as an argument differs

from the observed form and records metrics about the difference.

- Depending on the result, it updates PasswordFormManager to observe

a the new form.

- It calls fill (either directly or delayed) depending on a number of

factors (whether there was an update, whether there are predictions

after the update, whether the form manager is already waiting for

new predictions).



After the CL, callers need to do three things

- Call HasObservedFormChanged() to check whether an update is needed.

- Call (the existing method) UpdateFormManagerWithFormChanges().

- Call Fill().



This adds only a couple of lines in PasswordManager code, but it makes

it explicitly what is happening and will allow for easier reuse to

implement updates for dynamic form changes not detected by the

renderer path.



Finally, the CL adds unit tests for HasObservedFormChanged.





Bug: 1465803

Change-Id: I8d701f152ba1a7210b2c83b589d6d6e02a07d793

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4710605

Reviewed-by: Vasilii Sukhanov

Commit-Queue: Jan Keitel

Reviewed-by: Maria Kazinova

entry.title: Use a QUEUED TaskEnv and its RunUntilIdle
entry.content:
The new Rust-based JSON parser runs in a threadpool, instead of a

separate process, and this changes its behavior with respect to

RunUntilIdle. Processing threadpool tasks in QUEUED fashion, and running

the task environment until it is idle, work around these issues.

entry.title: [iOS][Toolbar] Move showPrerenderingAnimation to adaptive toolbar
entry.content:
Move showPrerenderingAnimation to adaptive toolbar as secondary toolbar

also has a progress bar. ToolbarCoordinator will call the method on both

toolbars but only the one with the omnibox will run the animation.



When bottom omnibox flag is disabled, secondary toolbar doesn't have a

progress bar and doesn't never has the omnibox.

entry.title: Fix a rare crash during a session creation
entry.content:
If the hosting system is under a heavy load it can happen that the

browser startup timeout expires before the DevToolsHttpClient kicks in.

Before this commit ChromeDriver skipped the part with the

DevToolsHttpClient use but it tried to execute the following code that

depended on the data received from the DevToolsHttpClient.

With this commit the code is able to detect such a situation and stop

its execution with a SessionNotCreated error.



Bug: 1467496

entry.title: Reland "[customize-chrome][cr2023] Establish dependencies of features in code"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 5f2a690589d8aaaa71181560acc2d70150773037.



Reason for revert: The revert of another CL fixed test failure. This CL is not related.



Original change's description:

> Revert "[customize-chrome][cr2023] Establish dependencies of features in code"

>

> This reverts commit f0db7b86166ef32ecdfbcb2a72e4a0abe6189db8.

>

> Reason for revert: Seems to be causing multiple failures:

> crbug.com/1467734

>

> Original change's description:

> > [customize-chrome][cr2023] Establish dependencies of features in code

> >

> > Chrome Refresh requires the Customize Chrome side panel. This CL ensures

> > that Chrome Refresh is only enabled if Customize Chrome is enabled, too.

> >

> > Additionally, this CL introduces a new feature flag that disables Chrome

> > Refresh even if Customize Chrome is enabled. This allows us to set up a

> > holdback experiment for the Customize Chrome side panel where both

> > experiment arms have Chrome Refresh disabled.

> >

> > Things to note:

> > * Only some Omnibox features need to be gated by Customize Chrome. This

> > CL adds a helper to gate those specific call sites. The helper lives

> > in //components/omnibox/common to work around cyclic dependency

> > issues. This CL modifies DEPS rules accordingly.

> > * This CL moves ntp_features into a new GN target so that users can

> > depend on it in isolation. This, too, works around cyclic dependency

> > issues.

> >

> > Bug: 1457991

> > Change-Id: I13ccb0df1cfa433aa5e10bc2bca5a7933913da6d

entry.content:
This patch adds the `kPhrase` mode to `LineBreakType`, and

support it in `LazyLineBreakIterator`.



When specified, it uses the AdaBoost ML engine in the ICU as

the underlying engine by the `lw=phrase` keyword.



This patch has no behavior changes as the core doesn't use

this mode yet.

entry.title: CookieSettings: Move GetCookieSettingsInternal to base class
entry.content:
GetCookieSettingsInternal is implemented twice: Once for the browser

process and once for the network process. This method is getting

more and more complicated and there is a risk for bugs due to

inconsistent behavior.

This CL extracts a couple small data access functions and moves the

main GetCookieSettingInternal method to CookieSettingsBase.

The GetCookieSettingWithMetadata logic in the network service

will be moved to the base class separately.

entry.title: Use InlinedVector in /media/gpu
entry.content:
Replace usages of base::StackVector with absl::InlinedVector. This is

not a pure rename, as the semantics are slightly different:



1. Methods like push_back() which were accessed with the -> operator in

StackVector are instead accessed with . with InlinedVector.



See also discussion thread in cxx@chromium.org:

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/cxx/c/jTfqVfU-Ka0/m/caaal90NCgAJ



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.

entry.title: Support for kEditedToSimilarValue observations.
entry.content:
Implements a function to calculate the Levenshtein distance between

strings, which is then used to derive kEditedToSimilarValue

observations.



The Levenshtein distance calculation is optimized using the fact that we

care about strings with a "small" edit-distance of k from each other.

This way, the DP can be optimized from O(|s1| * |s2|) to O(|s1| * k).

entry.title: [ios] Update WebStateListObserverBridge to call 2 APIs for the activation
entry.content:
We need to call 2 APIs, -didChangeWebStateList:change:status: and -webStateList:didChangeActiveWebState:oldWebState:atIndex:reason: to tell the activation event to observers because the observers are updated incrementally and some of them support the old API and the others support the new API.



The old API (-webStateList:didChangeActiveWebState:oldWebState:atIndex:reason:) will be removed after all observers are updated.

entry.title: [Autofill] Simplify TTF keyboard suppression
entry.content:
This CL simplifies the mechanism how Autofill tells the Android IME

to suppress itself. This simplification takes place only in Autofill

code.



Before this CL, it worked as follows:

- TouchToFillKeyboardSuppressor::{Suppress,Unsuppress}() called

- AutofillManager::SetShouldSuppressKeyboard() called

- ContentAutofillDriver::SetShouldSuppressKeyboard() called

- ContentAutofillRouter::SetShouldSuppressKeyboard() called

- ContentAutofillDriver::SetShouldSuppressKeyboardCallback(), which

set the member

- ContentAutofillDriver::should_suppress_keyboard_, which was returned

by the callback

- ContentAutofillDriver::suppress_showing_ime_callback_, which was

passed to and called by RenderWidgetHost.



This CL simplifies this in two ways:



Firstly, the callpath becomes a lot more direct:

- TouchToFillKeyboardSuppressor::{Suppress,Unsuppress}() makes

- TouchToFillKeyboardSuppressor::is_suppressing() true or false, which

is returned by a callback passed to and called by RenderWidgetHost.

The glue code code in //components/autofill is gone now.



Secondly, keyboard suppression is no longer frame-specific:

Previously, every ContentAutofillDriver had its own boolean. Now,

all frames of the tab refer to suppress the keyboard if and only if

TouchToFillKeyboardSuppressor::is_suppressing() is true. This means

less bookkeeping and fewer global variables.



Bug: 1247698, 1443645

Change-Id: Idf643404c21923a7789fcefd899e4d2cf0e562d0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4707797

Commit-Queue: Christoph Schwering

Code-Coverage: Findit

Reviewed-by: Friedrich Horschig

entry.title: Implement ProfileTokenQuality::AddObservationsForFilledForm().
entry.content:
Adds logic that finds all autofilled fields of the form passed to

AddObservationsForFilledForm(), from which no observation has been

collected yet (based on the FormAndFieldSignatureHash).

For these fields, a new observation is collected.



This CL also adds logic that determines the observation type from such

fields. For now, only accepted observation types are implemented, to

keep this CL at a reviewable size. The follow-up crrev.com/c/4625203

adds supported for edit-observations.

entry.content:
In addition to the UI changes, the commit also includes these changes:

because the existing test api files became very large. The PIN UI

adapting tests necessary anyway) was a good opportunity to organize

testing code.

into several smaller test cases.

setup UI is now a browser test.

entry.title: Browsing Data Model: Ensure MediaLicense access is reported correctly
entry.content:
The KeySystemConfigSelector was checking whether kLocalStorage access

was available to determine whether key access was allowed. This

resulted in an access report to local storage being ultimately

received by the PageSpecificContentSettings.



Media Licenses are a Quota managed type, and so to be correctly

represented in the in-context UI (and correctly deleted) they should

be reported as such.



This CL changes the KeySystemConfigSelector to check for IndexedDB

access instead, which ultimately presents as an access to quota

managed storage, and so license information will be deleted

correctly.



CL also introduces a debugging string into the BrowsingDataModel

test util to make determining the difference between expected and

actual entries simpler to debug.



Bug: 1271155

Change-Id: I6889b7cadc68d7a7ae8cdd9a960ac13696e905eb

entry.title: Implement ProfileTokenQuality::GetFormSignatureHash()
entry.content:
As discussed with the privacy team, we don't want to store a hash

of form + field signature with every observation. This would be

problematic because even if the hash is low entropy, by combining

hashes from different observations collected during the same form

submit, more information about the form can be inferred.



Instead, we only store a 1 byte hash of the form signature with every

observation. As such, the same hash is duplicated in every observation

collected during the same form submit. This is unproblematic for

Autofill's purposes, since the hash is only used to deduplicate

observations for the same field type.



Bug: 1453650

Change-Id: I006014496a8b9d06b934c2f62d6cca0c4140f6a0

entry.title: Send wl_pointer::axis_source alongside wl_pointer::axis_stop
entry.content:
Currently the frame where we send axis_stop, when the user finishes

scrolling on the trackpad, does not contain an axis_source. The wayland

spec indicates we should send an axis_stop event "when the user lifts

the finger off the device", but by omitting the source the stop is

treated as for an unknown source.



While Lacros does not seem to check the axis_source here (as per

WaylandEventSource::ProcessPointerScrollData()), some Crostini apps

running under wayland can get confused (e.g. Firefox scrolling gets

stuck as per linked bug).



Bug: b/291850280

This is a reland of commit 9159e865381e8f7b99578530011a610881dd24e0

files, `open-database-set-empty-verion-expected.txt`, which were

automatically added by rebaseline tool, `blink_tool.py rebaseline-cl`.



After re-running `rebaseline-cl` for this reland CL, the same

expectation files were still pulled from Mac Bots. It appears that

manual cleanup is necessary to remove unwanted expectation files

following the rebaseline-cl process.

also passed the CQ. So I am not entirely confident that this

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Guard MT21Decompressor correctly
entry.content:
The MT21Decompressor was recently introduced for ChromeOS. This function

is written in NEON intrinisics and so is ARM specific. However references

to it added to V4L2VDA are not correctly guarded. This breaks the build

on Linux, on both ARM64 and x86_64.



Nothing limits the function to ChromeOS. A user running Chrome on an

MT8173 device running Linux could theoretically take advantage of it.

The implementation, due to its use of intrinsics, is still limited to

ARM.



Add guards around references to MT21Decompressor in V4L2VDA. Also

loosen the requirements so that it can be built on Linux.



Bug: b:284994884, b:258331312, b:291169645

Change-Id: Ib1164c2286735a3ebd30bd1cd53857d01234da74

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4710354

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Explicitly declare MT21DecompressorJob deconstructor
entry.content:
Chromium style check gives the following error on Linux builds:



../../media/gpu/v4l2/mt21/mt21_decompressor.h:46:8: error: [chromium-style] Classes that are ref-counted should have explicit destructors that are declared protected or private.

46 | struct MT21DecompressionJob : public base::RefCounted {

| ^

../../media/gpu/v4l2/mt21/mt21_decompressor.h:46:31: note: [chromium-style] 'MT21DecompressionJob' inherits from 'base::RefCounted' here

46 | struct MT21DecompressionJob : public base::RefCounted {

| ^



Since MT21DecompressorJob has no actual state or resources to take care

of, just explicitly declare a private default deconstructor.



Bug: b:258331312, b:291169645

Change-Id: I8e1f222791223b3e244eeee9f2cf713460cee902

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4710353

Reviewed-by: Justin Green

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1175279}

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Convert raw pointers in MT21Decompressor to raw_ptr<T>
entry.content:
Chromium style requires using raw_ptr instead of raw pointers.



For pointers to memory allocated within the class, switch to

raw_ptr. For pointers to destination frame buffers, since these are

always allocated with GBM or other system mechanisms, add

RAW_PTR_EXCLUSION.

entry.title: History service: Terminate on initialization failure.
entry.content:
The VisitedLinkWriter (a dependency of history service) can fail to

initialize due to insufficient memory. The history service attempts to

gracefully handle this with a LOG(WARNING) but this just results in more

confusing nullptr dereferences in services that depend on the history

service. Instead we terminate immediately after logging an error.

entry.title: base/trace_event: Add build flag for Perfetto Trace Processor
entry.content:
Add a build flag (`use_perfetto_trace_processor`) for selecting whether

//base should use the Perfetto trace processor for converting

protobuf-format traces into the legacy JSON format.



This flag allows libchrome to enable the `use_perfetto_client_library`

flag to match the //base default and drop any dependency on the legacy

trace log. This new flag is needed because the Perfetto client library

doesn't include the trace processor, whereas //base can keep using the

trace processor from //third_party/perfetto.

entry.title: Simplify AutofillTable migration logic.
entry.content:
Some of the AutofillTable migration logic drops columns. Since

Chromium's SQLite version doesn't support the "ALTER TABLE DROP COLUMN"

syntax, this is done by:

- Creating a new table without the column.

- SELECTing all data from the existing table and inserting it into

the new table.

- Dropping the old table.

- Renaming the new table to the old table's name.



This CL creates a helper function MoveDataAndReplaceTable() to simplify

some of this process. This removes some hardcoded SQL queries and thus

removes string constants from the binary, saving about 360 bytes :)

entry.title: Use InlinedVector in /content/browser/cache_storage
entry.content:
Replace usages of base::StackVector with absl::InlinedVector. This is

not a pure rename, as the semantics are slightly different:



1. Methods like push_back() which were accessed with the -> operator in

StackVector are instead accessed with . with InlinedVector.

2. InlinedVector's iterators are pointers, so bare "auto" cannot be used

with them.



See also discussion thread in cxx@chromium.org:

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/cxx/c/jTfqVfU-Ka0/m/caaal90NCgAJ



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=jsbell@chromium.org

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Include base/task/bind_post_task.h in V4L2StatefulVD
entry.content:
V4L2StatefulVD uses base::BindPostTaskToCurrentDefault(), but doesn't

include its header file directly. This causes build errors on Linux:



../../media/gpu/v4l2/v4l2_stateful_video_decoder.cc:657:17: error: no member named 'BindPostTaskToCurrentDefault' in namespace 'base'

657 | base::BindPostTaskToCurrentDefault(base::BindOnce(

| ~~~~~~^

../../media/gpu/v4l2/v4l2_stateful_video_decoder.cc:700:51: error: no member named 'BindPostTaskToCurrentDefault' in namespace 'base'

700 | wrapped_frame->AddDestructionObserver(base::BindPostTaskToCurrentDefault(

| ~~~~~~^



Explicitly include its header file to fix this.

entry.title: Revert "[customize-chrome][cr2023] Establish dependencies of features in code"
entry.content:
This reverts commit f0db7b86166ef32ecdfbcb2a72e4a0abe6189db8.



Reason for revert: Seems to be causing multiple failures:

crbug.com/1467734



Original change's description:

> [customize-chrome][cr2023] Establish dependencies of features in code

>

> Chrome Refresh requires the Customize Chrome side panel. This CL ensures

> that Chrome Refresh is only enabled if Customize Chrome is enabled, too.

>

> Additionally, this CL introduces a new feature flag that disables Chrome

> Refresh even if Customize Chrome is enabled. This allows us to set up a

> holdback experiment for the Customize Chrome side panel where both

> experiment arms have Chrome Refresh disabled.

>

> Things to note:

> * Only some Omnibox features need to be gated by Customize Chrome. This

> CL adds a helper to gate those specific call sites. The helper lives

> in //components/omnibox/common to work around cyclic dependency

> issues. This CL modifies DEPS rules accordingly.

> * This CL moves ntp_features into a new GN target so that users can

> depend on it in isolation. This, too, works around cyclic dependency

> issues.

>

> Bug: 1457991

> Change-Id: I13ccb0df1cfa433aa5e10bc2bca5a7933913da6d

entry.title: [FilesTrash] Disable invoke-sharesheet action when in Trash root
entry.content:
Files in Trash are not actually representative of the file on disk. They

are actually the name in their metadata + the location on disk. The

invoke-sharesheet (Share) action is not feasible and has been disabled

whilst in the Trash root.
